intro: Apassalus diffusus var. glabratus, commonly known as the smooth apassalus, is a rare and lesser-known plant species characterized by its unique botanical features. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in temperate forest regions. The plant has elongated, lance-shaped leaves that are smooth and glabrous, giving it its varietal name. Its flowers are small, clustered in dense inflorescences, and are usually pale green to white in color. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
